cab.content: 3ilitary Secret.1270 From Viceroy, Army Department, to Secretary of State for India, 21th January 1920. (Received 29th.) 105 L. Malleson wires, 23rd January, that Agent reports from Merv : - (1) Three military trains passed westward during the last three clays, carrying,in addition to troops, animals and stores, one seaplane and two large searchlights. (2) Attitude of both Bolsheviks and Afghans towards Persians becomesincreasingly hostile. (3) Arrivals from Tashkent! report arrival there of 35 high civil and militaryofficials, including Germans, in a special train from Moscow. (4) Tashkent! reports also indicate that Bolsheviks' moderate tone and assurances that they are only fighting aristocracy and capitalists have brought many officials of old (corrupt group ? time) regiment of cavalry into their service.
